FOUND IN: Cheese: A versatile dairy product made by coagulating milk protein, usually rennet or an acid such as lemon juice.
Sous Chef: A chef who works closely with the head chef in a restaurant kitchen, assisting in preparation of meals for guests, including managing ingredients and cooking techniques.
Stomping tread: Walking forcefully and heavily upon the ground, often accompanied by audible impact.
Aiding and abetting (legal term referring to assistance in committing a crime, though not directly committing the act itself)
Triceratops: A well-known herbivorous ceratopsid dinosaur characterized by its large bony frill, three prominent facial horns, and a long tail club.
Maile (Hawaiian leis made from dried leaves of the hala tree, commonly used as a symbolic representation of a garland in Polynesian culture)
